item.description:
5-6 mile hike to the historic Quincy Quarries in the Blue Hills Reservation. Some ledges to cross, hiking boots are required, water, snack. Rain cancels.   Hike leader Ellie stressed that good hiking boots are strongly recommended and noted that anyone coming should expect to walk the entire 5-6 mile hike. (No, there won't be any rock-climbing like what is shown in the picture at left. However, there will be rock ledges to climb like what is shown below.)

Directions: Meet at Shea Rink at 10 AM, 651 Willard St, Quincy, from Rte. I-93/128 exit 6, go north on Willard St 0.7 miles, parking on left.

 

 

More info about the Quincy Quarries is available.

Leader: Ellie MacPherson

This is an Appalachian Mountain Club hike led by an Appalachian Mountain Club Leader, Ellie MacPherson, who is also one of our members.

We will meet at 7:30 in the parking lot of the McDonald's at Exit 5 off Route 3 for carpooling to breakfast and beyond.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Quincy Quarries
